alert.note: Alert for Admiralty Island; Cape Fairweather to Lisianski Strait; City and Borough of Juneau; City and Borough of Sitka; City and Borough of Wrangell; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay; Petersburg Borough; Western Kupreanof and Kuiu Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 17 at 4:44PM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: Low pressure has moved into the Gulf of Alaska, bringing widespread moderate to heavy rain along with strong winds. Around a half an inch of rain has been measured in some areas over the last 12 hours and occasional gusts to 40 mph have been observed along the outer coast so far. Confidence remains high on widespread total rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches across the region through Thursday. Wind gusts to 40 mph are also likely especially for the outer coast Tuesday night. Strong winds from this storm combined with saturated soils will also bring concerns for tree falls, mainly along river banks at this time. Care should be taken now to test bilge pumps and make vessels ready for long periods of heavy rain. This is an evolving and changing situation. Stay tuned to the National Weather Service for updates at weather.gov/Juneau and on social media.
